column4: anyone, I have a ubuntu desktop with apache web server, however it seems like its blocking when i try to access from a different comptuer
anyone know?
it sounds like a bad config; is it apache2?
yes
Right...
Installed from the repositories?
yes sir
the latest version is 2.2.4... Vanilla install? As in, you haven't reconfigured it, have you?
i haven't configured it,  what is vanilla?  will 2,2,4 fix the problem?
can you do cat /etc/apache2/apache2.conf | grep Listen && cat /etc/apache2/httpd.conf | grep Listen for me and paste the output?
I copied your command "cat /etc/apache2/apache2.conf | grep Listen && cat /etc/apache2/httpd.conf | grep Listen" and there was no output
No output... that sounds weird.
The Listen setting in the Apache config files specifies who to allow to connect to. It could be a router problem.
yea cus this network is at work so could it be a firewall?
It could be a router problem. You'd have to setup router forwarding for port 80 to your local machine.
Port forwarding, even
yea I bet its behind the firewall or the port isn't open, how would i open port 80?
You would have to configure your router, and with that, I'm afraid I can't help you. Find your user manual.
yea i wouldn't be able to change router at work lol
hehe :)
